resources.name: Introduction to HTML
resources.description: At its heart, HTML is a fairly simple language made up of elements, which can be applied to pieces of text to give them different meaning in a document.

resources.name: What is accessibility?
resources.description: Accessibility is the practice of making your websites usable by as many people as possible.

resources.name: Learn to style HTML using CSS
resources.description: HTML is used to define the structure and semantics of your content, CSS is used to style it and lay it out.

resources.name: Basic Concepts of grid layout
resources.description: CSS Grid Layout introduces a two-dimensional grid system to CSS. Grids can be used to lay out major page areas or small user interface elements.

resources.name: Relationship of grid layout to other layout methods
resources.description: CSS Grid Layout has been designed to work alongside other parts of CSS, as part of a complete system for doing the layout.

resources.name: A re-introduction to JavaScript
resources.description: Why a re-introduction? Because JavaScript is notorious for being misunderstood. It is often derided as being a toy, but beneath its layer of deceptive simplicity, powerful language features await.

resources.name: The Modern JavaScript Tutorial
resources.description: How it's done now. From the basics to advanced topics with simple, but detailed explanations.

resources.name: JavaScript Cheatsheet
resources.description: This basic cheat sheet, mostly based on the lessons on freeCodeCamp, tries to provide a basic reference for beginner and advanced developers and lower the entry barrier for newcomers.
